tags.name: params.instanceId
tags.description: - client id

tags.name: params.caller
tags.description: - whether or not we initiated the call

tags.name: [params.receiveOnly]
tags.description: - whether or not we accept media

tags.name: [params.sendOnly]
tags.description: - whether or not we send media

tags.name: [params.needDirectConnection]
tags.description: - flag to enable skipping media & opening direct connection.

tags.name: [params.forceTurn]
tags.description:
- If true, media is not allowed to flow peer-to-peer and must flow through
relay servers. If it cannot flow through relay servers, the call will fail.

tags.name: [params.disableTurn]
tags.description:
- If true, media is not allowed to flow through relay servers; it is
required to flow peer-to-peer. If it cannot, the call will fail.

tags.name: params.remoteEndpoint
tags.description: - The endpoint who is being called.

tags.name: [params.connectionId]
tags.description: - The connection ID of the remoteEndpoint.

tags.name: [params.previewLocalMedia]
tags.description:
- A function to call if the developer
wants to perform an action between local media becoming available and calling approve().

tags.name: params.signalOffer
tags.description: - Signaling action from SignalingChannel.

tags.name: params.signalConnected
tags.description: - Signaling action from SignalingChannel.

tags.name: params.signalAnswer
tags.description: - Signaling action from SignalingChannel.

tags.name: params.signalHangup
tags.description: - Signaling action from SignalingChannel.

tags.name: params.signalReport
tags.description: - Signaling action from SignalingChannel.

tags.name: params.signalCandidate
tags.description: - Signaling action from SignalingChannel.

tags.name: [params.onError]
tags.description:
- Callback for errors that happen during call setup or
media renegotiation.

tags.name: [params.onLocalMedia]
tags.description:
- Callback for receiving an HTML5 Video
element with the local audio and/or video attached.

tags.name: [params.onConnect]
tags.description: - Callback for the remote video element.

tags.name: [params.onHangup]
tags.description:
- Callback for when the call is ended, whether or not
it was ended in a graceful manner. TODO: add the hangup reason to the Event.

tags.name: [params.onMute]
tags.description:
- Callback for changing the mute state on any type of media.
This callback will be called when media is muted or unmuted.

tags.name: [params.onAnswer]
tags.description: - Callback for when the callee answers the call.

tags.name: [params.onRequestingMedia]
tags.description:
- Callback for when the app is waiting
for the user to give permission to start getting audio or video.

tags.name: [params.onApprove]
tags.description:
- Callback for when the user approves local media. This
callback will be called whether or not the approval was based on user feedback. I. e., it will be called even if
the approval was automatic.

tags.name: [params.onAllow]
tags.description:
- Callback for when the browser gives us access to the
user's media. This event gets called even if the allow process is automatic, i. e., permission and media is
granted by the browser without asking the user to approve it.

tags.name: params.videoLocalElement
tags.description: - Pass in an optional html video element to have local video attached to it.

tags.name: params.videoRemoteElement
tags.description: - Pass in an optional html video element to have remote video attached to it.

description.full:
A respoke.Call is Respoke's interface into a WebRTC call, including getUserMedia, path and codec negotation, and call state.

There are several methods on an instance of respoke.Client which return a respoke.Call.
description.summary: A respoke.Call is Respoke's interface into a WebRTC call, including getUserMedia, path and codec negotation, and call state.
description.body: There are several methods on an instance of respoke.Client which return a respoke.Call.

description.full: @memberof! respoke.Call
description.summary: @memberof! respoke.Call

description.full: A name to identify the type of object.
description.summary: A name to identify the type of object.

code: that.className = 'respoke.Call';

description.full: Whether or not the client is the caller of the call.
description.summary: Whether or not the client is the caller of the call.

code: that.caller = !!that.caller;

description.full: The call ID.
description.summary: The call ID.

description.full: Promise used to trigger actions dependant upon having received media or a datachannel.
description.summary: Promise used to trigger actions dependant upon having received media or a datachannel.

description.full: Promise used to trigger notification of a request for renegotiating media. For the caller of the renegotiation (which doesn't have to be the same as the caller of the call), this is resolved or rejected as soon as the 'accept' or 'reject' signal is received. For the callee, it is resolved or rejected only after the developer or user approves or rejects the modify.
description.summary: Promise used to trigger notification of a request for renegotiating media. For the caller of the renegotiation (which doesn't have to be the same as the caller of the call), this is resolved or rejected as soon as the 'accept' or 'reject' signal is received. For the callee, it is resolved or rejected only after the developer or user approves or rejects the modify.

description.full: Set up promises. If we're not the caller, we need to listen for approval AND the remote SDP to come in before we can act on the call. Save parameters sent in with the constructor, then delete them off the call. If this call was initiated with a DirectConnection, set it up so answer() will be the approval mechanism.
description.summary: Set up promises. If we're not the caller, we need to listen for approval AND the remote SDP to come in before we can act on the call. Save parameters sent in with the constructor, then delete them off the call. If this call was initiated with a DirectConnection, set it up so answer() will be the approval mechanism.

description.full: This happens when the call is hung up automatically, for instance due to the lack of an onCall handler. In this case, pc has been set to null in hangup. The call has already failed, and the invocation of this function is an artifact of async code not being finished yet, so we can just skip all of this setup.
description.summary: This happens when the call is hung up automatically, for instance due to the lack of an onCall handler. In this case, pc has been set to null in hangup. description.full:
Answer the call and start the process of obtaining media. This method is called automatically on the caller's side. This method must be called on the callee's side to indicate that the endpoint does wish to accept the call. The app will have a later opportunity, by passing a callback named previewLocalMedia, to approve or reject the call based on whether audio and/or video is working and is working at an acceptable level.

client.listen('call', function (evt) {
    if (!evt.call.caller) {
        evt.call.answer();
    }
});
description.summary: Answer the call and start the process of obtaining media. This method is called automatically on the caller's side. This method must be called on the callee's side to indicate that the endpoint does wish to accept the call. The app will have a later opportunity, by passing a callback named previewLocalMedia, to approve or reject the call based on whether audio and/or video is working and is working at an acceptable level.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: The call was answered.
description.summary: The call was answered.

description.full:
Accept a request to modify the media on the call. This method should be called within the Call#modify event listener, which gives the developer or website user a chance to see what changes are proposed and to accept or reject them.

call.listen('modify', function (evt) {
    evt.call.accept();
});
description.summary: Accept a request to modify the media on the call. This method should be called within the Call#modify event listener, which gives the developer or website user a chance to see what changes are proposed and to accept or reject them.

code: that.accept = that.answer;

description.full:
Start the process of network and media negotiation. If the app passes in a callback named previewLocalMedia in order to allow the logged-in person a chance to base their decision to continue the call on whether audio and/or video is working correctly, this method must be called on both sides in order to begin the call. If call.approve() is called, the call will progress as expected. If call.reject() is called, the call will be aborted.

call.listen('local-stream-received', function (evt) {
    if (userLikesVideo()) {
        evt.call.approve();
    }
});
description.summary: Start the process of network and media negotiation. If the app passes in a callback named previewLocalMedia in order to allow the logged-in person a chance to base their decision to continue the call on whether audio and/or video is working correctly, this method must be called on both sides in order to begin the call. If call.approve() is called, the call will progress as expected. If call.reject() is called, the call will be aborted.

tags.name: [params.onError]

description.full:
The plugin respoke.MediaStats must be loaded before using this method.

Start the process of listening for a continuous stream of statistics about the flow of audio and/or video. Since we have to wait for both the answer and offer to be available before starting statistics, the library returns a promise for the stats object. The statistics object does not contain the statistics; rather it contains methods of interacting with the actions of obtaining statistics. To obtain the actual statistics one time, use stats.getStats(); use the onStats callback to obtain a continuous stream of statistics every interval seconds. Returns null if stats module is not loaded.

call.getStats({
    onStats: function (evt) {
        console.log('Stats', evt.stats);
    }
}).done(function () {
    console.log('Stats started');
}, function (err) {
    console.log('Call is already hung up.');
});
description.summary: The plugin respoke.MediaStats must be loaded before using this method.
description.body:
Start the process of listening for a continuous stream of statistics about the flow of audio and/or video. Since we have to wait for both the answer and offer to be available before starting statistics, the library returns a promise for the stats object. The statistics object does not contain the statistics; rather it contains methods of interacting with the actions of obtaining statistics. To obtain the actual statistics one time, use stats.getStats(); use the onStats callback to obtain a continuous stream of statistics every interval seconds. Returns null if stats module is not loaded.

call.getStats({
    onStats: function (evt) {
        console.log('Stats', evt.stats);
    }
}).done(function () {
    console.log('Stats started');
}, function (err) {
    console.log('Call is already hung up.');
});

description.full:
Return local video element with the logged-in endpoint's audio and/or video streams attached to it.

var el = call.getLocalElement();
container.append(el);
description.summary: Return local video element with the logged-in endpoint's audio and/or video streams attached to it.

description.full:
Return remote video element with the remote endpoint's audio and/or video streams attached to it.

var el = call.getRemoteElement();
container.append(el);

description.full: Create the RTCPeerConnection and add handlers. Process any offer we have already received. This method is called after answer() so we cannot use this method to set up the DirectConnection.

description.full: The browser is asking for permission to access the User's media. This would be an ideal time to modify the UI of the application so that the user notices the request for permissions and approves it.

description.full: The user has approved the request for media. Any UI changes made to remind the user to click Allow should be canceled now. This event is the same as the onAllow callback. This event gets fired even if the allow process is automatic, i. e., permission and media is granted by the browser without asking the user to approve it.
description.summary: The user has approved the request for media. Any UI changes made to remind the user to click Allow should be canceled now. This event is the same as the onAllow callback. This event gets fired even if the allow process is automatic, i. e., permission and media is granted by the browser without asking the user to approve it.

description.full:
Get the direct connection on this call, if it exists.

var dc = call.getDirectConnection();
if (!dc) {
    console.log("No direct connection has been started.");
} else {
    dc.sendMessage({message: 'hi'});
}
description.summary: Get the direct connection on this call, if it exists.
description.body:
var dc = call.getDirectConnection();
if (!dc) {
    console.log("No direct connection has been started.");
} else {
    dc.sendMessage({message: 'hi'});
}

description.full: Remove a direct connection from the existing call. If there is no other media, this will hang up the call.
description.summary: Remove a direct connection from the existing call. If there is no other media, this will hang up the call.

description.full:
Add a direct connection to the existing call.

call.addDirectConnection({
    onOpen: function (evt) {
        console.log("Direct connection open!");
    }
});

description.full: This event is fired when the logged-in endpoint is receiving a request to open a direct connection to another endpoint. If the user wishes to allow the direct connection, calling evt.directConnection.accept() will allow the connection to be set up.
description.summary: This event is fired when the logged-in endpoint is receiving a request to open a direct connection to another endpoint. If the user wishes to allow the direct connection, calling evt.directConnection.accept() will allow the connection to be set up.

description.full: Close the direct connection.
description.summary: Close the direct connection.

{boolean} params.signal Optional flag to indicate whether to send or suppress sending
a hangup signal to the remote side.

description.full: Tear down the call, release user media. Send a hangup signal to the remote party if signal is not false and we have not received a hangup signal from the remote party.
description.summary: Tear down the call, release user media. Send a hangup signal to the remote party if signal is not false and we have not received a hangup signal from the remote party.

description.full: Tear down the call, release user media. Send a hangup signal to the remote party if signal is not false and we have not received a hangup signal from the remote party. This is an event handler added to the state machine via once.
description.summary: Tear down the call, release user media. Send a hangup signal to the remote party if signal is not false and we have not received a hangup signal from the remote party. This is an event handler added to the state machine via once.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: Indicates a request to add something to an existing call. If 'constraints' is set, evt.constraints describes the media the other side has added. In this case, call.approve() must be called in order to approve the new media and send the same type of media. If directConnection exists, the other side wishes to to open a direct connection. In order to approve, call directConnection.accept(). In either case, call.reject() and directConnection.reject() can be called to decline the request to add to the call.
description.summary: Indicates a request to add something to an existing call. If 'constraints' is set, evt.constraints describes the media the other side has added. In this case, call.approve() must be called in order to approve the new media and send the same type of media. If directConnection exists, the other side wishes to to open a direct connection. In order to approve, call directConnection.accept(). In either case, call.reject() and directConnection.reject() can be called to decline the request to add to the call.

description.full: Save the answer and tell the browser about it.

description.full: If audio is muted, unmute. If not muted, mute.

description.summary: Indicate whether the call has media flowing.

description.full: Mute all local video streams.

description.summary: Unmute all local video streams.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: This event provides notification for when an incoming call is being received. If the user wishes to allow the call, the app should call evt.call.answer() to answer the call.
description.summary: This event provides notification for when an incoming call is being received. If the user wishes to allow the call, the app should call evt.call.answer() to answer the call.

description.full: Handle an error that resulted from a method call.
description.summary: Handle an error that resulted from a method call.

description.full: Handle the successful kick-off of stats on a call.
description.summary: Handle the successful kick-off of stats on a call.

description.full: Handle obtaining media successfully.
description.summary: Handle obtaining media successfully.

tags.string:
respoke.Call.onLocalMedia Callback for receiving an HTML5 Video
element with the local audio and/or video attached.

tags.description: The outgoingMedia property on the call.

tags.name: evt.name
tags.description: - The event name.

description.full: When on a call, receive local media when it becomes available. This is what you will need to provide if you want to show the user their own video during a call. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#local-stream-received is fired.
description.summary: When on a call, receive local media when it becomes available. This is what you will need to provide if you want to show the user their own video during a call. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#local-stream-received is fired.

tags.name: evt.element
tags.description: - the HTML5 Video element with the new stream attached.

tags.name: evt.name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: When on a call, receive remote media when it becomes available. This is what you will need to provide if you want to show the user the other party's video during a call. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#connect is fired.
description.summary: When on a call, receive remote media when it becomes available. This is what you will need to provide if you want to show the user the other party's video during a call. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#connect is fired.

tags.name: evt.reason
tags.description: - A human-readable description of the error.

tags.name: evt.name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: When a call is in setup or media renegotiation happens. This callback will be called every time respoke.Call#error.
description.summary: When a call is in setup or media renegotiation happens. This callback will be called every time respoke.Call#error.

tags.name: evt.sentSignal
tags.description: - Whether or not we sent a 'hangup' signal to the other party.

tags.name: evt.name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: When on a call, receive notification the call has been hung up. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#hangup is fired.
description.summary: When on a call, receive notification the call has been hung up. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#hangup is fired.

description.full: Called when changing the mute state on any type of media. This callback will be called when media is muted or unmuted. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#mute is fired.
description.summary: Called when changing the mute state on any type of media. This callback will be called when media is muted or unmuted. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#mute is fired.

description.full: Called when the callee answers the call. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#answer is fired.
description.summary: Called when the callee answers the call. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#answer is fired.

description.full: Called when the user approves local media. This callback will be called whether or not the approval was based on user feedback. I. e., it will be called even if the approval was automatic. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#approve is fired.
description.summary: Called when the user approves local media. This callback will be called whether or not the approval was based on user feedback. I. e., it will be called even if the approval was automatic. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#approve is fired.

tags.name: evt.name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: When setting up a call, receive notification that the browser has granted access to media. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#allow is fired.
description.summary: When setting up a call, receive notification that the browser has granted access to media. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#allow is fired.

tags.name: evt.name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: When setting up a call, receive notification that the app has asked the browser for permission to get audio or video and is waiting on the browser to grant or reject permission. This callback will be called every time respoke.Call#requesting-media is fired.
description.summary: When setting up a call, receive notification that the app has asked the browser for permission to get audio or video and is waiting on the browser to grant or reject permission. This callback will be called every time respoke.Call#requesting-media is fired.

tags.name: evt.stats
tags.description: - an object with stats in it.

tags.name: evt.name
tags.description: - the event name.

description.full: The use of stats requires an additional module to Respoke. When on a call, receive periodic statistical information about the call, including the codec, lost packets, and bandwidth being consumed. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#stats is fired.
description.summary: The use of stats requires an additional module to Respoke. When on a call, receive periodic statistical information about the call, including the codec, lost packets, and bandwidth being consumed. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#stats is fired.

tags.name: element
tags.description: - the HTML5 Video element with the new stream attached.

description.full: When on a call, receive local media when it becomes available. This is what you will need to provide if you want to allow the user to preview and approve or reject their own video before a call. If this callback is provided, Respoke will wait for call.answer() to be called before proceeding. If this callback is not provided, Respoke will proceed without waiting for user input. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#local-stream-received is fired.
description.summary: When on a call, receive local media when it becomes available. This is what you will need to provide if you want to allow the user to preview and approve or reject their own video before a call. If this callback is provided, Respoke will wait for call.answer() to be called before proceeding. If this callback is not provided, Respoke will proceed without waiting for user input. This callback is called every time respoke.Call#local-stream-received is fired.

description.full: Receive the DirectConnection.
description.summary: Receive the DirectConnection.
